detailed_goals: Continue developing the report template for seasonal influenza trend analysis.
Focus on data visualization elements and incorporate feedback from stakeholders.
Discuss system modifications with EHR vendor to support influenza data collection.
Evaluate vendor proposals and negotiate contracts.
Continue to identify specific clinical workflows to be modified for influenza data capture within EHR.
Implement prompts for influenza diagnosis and testing into the physician examination workflow.
Continue to define initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking.
Set weekly targets for improvement.
Accurately assess patients for influenza symptoms using standardized protocols and tools integrated into the EHR
Enter patient data into the EHR accurately and completely, including demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results.
Work with EHR vendor to develop and configure necessary system updates or modifications
Configure new data fields, customize existing workflows, and implement validation rules.
Abstract data from the most recent influenza season (e.g., 2023-2024).
Prioritize electronic records if available. (Mateo Rodriguez, Grace Ito) - Target: 200 records per week.
Map the specific EHR data elements identified in Subtask 1 to the corresponding columns in the new tables.
Ensure that all required data elements are represented in the schema.
Continue defining initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza tracking.
Set weekly targets for improvement.
Document influenza vaccination status in the EHR, and document any known allergies or contraindications to influenza vaccination.
Refer any questions about the vaccine to the ordering provider

Troubleshoot EHR system issues and data collection problems reported by users.
Escalate complex technical issues to senior IT staff or the EHR vendor, ensuring proper documentation and communication of the problem.
Conduct a thorough root cause analysis for each identified data quality issue to determine the underlying cause(s).
Categorize the root causes into common themes (e.g., training gaps, system errors, workflow inefficiencies, data definition issues).

Gather Feedback from Clinical Staff: I will proactively solicit feedback from physicians, nurses, and other clinical staff regarding the EHR system, data collection processes, and training materials.
Attend Project Meetings: I will attend project meetings to stay informed about the project's progress, challenges, and key decisions.
